Results for

CarNavigationStatusManager

public abstract class CarNavigationStatusManager
extends Object

java.lang.Object
   ↳ android.support.car.navigation.CarNavigationStatusManager

APIs for providing navigation status to the instrument cluster. For cars that have a navigation display built into the instrument cluster, a navigation application should also provide turn-by-turn information to the cluster through this manager.

Navigation applications should first call requestAppFocus(int, android.support.car.CarAppFocusManager.OnAppFocusOwnershipCallback) and request APP_FOCUS_TYPE_NAVIGATION.

After navigation focus is granted, applications should call sendNavigationStatus(STATUS_ACTIVE); to initialize the cluster and let it know the app will be sending turn events. Then, for each turn of the turn-by-turn guidance, the app calls sendNavigationTurnEvent(int, CharSequence, int, int, int); this sends image data to the cluster (and is why that data is not sent in subsequent turn distance events). To update the distance and time to the next turn, the app should make periodic calls to sendNavigationTurnDistanceEvent(int, int, int, int).

Calling sendNavigationStatus(STATUS_INACTIVE); when the route is completed allows the car to use the cluster panel for other data (such as media, weather, etc.) and is what a well behaved app is expected to do.

Summary

void addListener (CarNavigationStatusManager.CarNavigationCallback callback)

Parameters
callback CarNavigationStatusManager.CarNavigationCallback: CarNavigationStatusManager.CarNavigationCallback to be registered, replacing any existing listeners.
Throws
CarNotConnectedException if the connection to the car service has been lost.

Unregister the CarNavigationStatusManager.CarNavigationCallback associated with this instance.

sendNavigationStatus

void sendNavigationStatus (int status)

This method is deprecated.
Use ERROR(/#sendEvent(int, Bundle)) instead.

Inform the instrument cluster if navigation is active or not.

Parameters
status int: New instrument cluster navigation status, one of the STATUS_* constants in this class.
Throws
CarNotConnectedException if the connection to the car service has been lost.

sendNavigationTurnDistanceEvent

void sendNavigationTurnDistanceEvent (int distanceMeters, 
                int timeSeconds, 
                int displayDistanceMillis, 
                int displayDistanceUnit)

This method is deprecated.
Use ERROR(/#sendEvent(int, Bundle)) instead.

Send a Navigation Next Step Distance event to the car.

Parameters
distanceMeters int: Distance to next event in meters.
timeSeconds int: Time to next event in seconds.
displayDistanceMillis int: Distance to the next event formatted as it will be displayed by the calling app, in milli-units. For example, 1.25 should be supplied as 1250.
displayDistanceUnit int: Unit type to use on of the DISTANCE_* types defined in this file.
Returns
void Returns true if successful.
Throws
CarNotConnectedException if the connection to the car service has been lost.

sendNavigationTurnEvent

void sendNavigationTurnEvent (int turnEvent, 
                CharSequence eventName, 
                int turnAngle, 
                int turnNumber, 
                int turnSide)

This method is deprecated.
Use ERROR(/#sendEvent(int, Bundle)) instead.

Send a Navigation Next Step event to the car.

Roundabout Example: In a roundabout with four, evenly spaced exits, the first exit is turnNumber=1, turnAngle=90; the second exit is turnNumber=2, turnAngle=180; the third exit is turnNumber=3, turnAngle=270. turnNumber and turnAngle are counted in the direction of travel around the roundabout (clockwise for roads where the car drives on the left side of the road, such as Australia; counter-clockwise for roads where the car drives on the right side of the road, such as the USA).

Parameters
turnEvent int: Turn event type (TURN_TURN, TURN_U_TURN, TURN_ROUNDABOUT_ENTER_AND_EXIT, etc).
eventName CharSequence: Name of the turn event like road name to turn. For example "Charleston road" in "Turn right to Charleston road"
turnAngle int: Turn angle in degrees between the roundabout entry and exit (0..359). Used only for event type TURN_ROUNDABOUT_ENTER_AND_EXIT. -1 if unused.
turnNumber int: Turn number, counting from the roundabout entry to the exit. Used only for event type TURN_ROUNDABOUT_ENTER_AND_EXIT. -1 if unused.
turnSide int: Turn side (TURN_SIDE_LEFT, TURN_SIDE_RIGHT or TURN_SIDE_UNSPECIFIED).
Throws
CarNotConnectedException if the connection to the car service has been lost.
